alert.note: Alert for Middle Rio Grande Valley; Northwest Highlands; Northwest Plateau; Sandia Manzano And Gallinas Mountains; West Central Highlands (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued April 05 at 2:01PM MDT until April 06 at 8:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT THROUGH 8 PM TODAY FOR ALL AREAS BELOW SNOWPACK EXCEPT THE NORTH CENTRAL MOUNTAINS FOR STRONG WINDS, LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY AND AN UNSTABLE AIRMASS... ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM NOON THROUGH 8 PM WEDNESDAY FOR PORTIONS OF WESTERN AND CENTRAL NEW MEXICO BELOW SNOWPACK FOR STRONG WINDS, LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY AND AN UNSTABLE AIRMASS... .Strong west to northwest winds will continue through this evening. These winds will be combined with minimum relative humidity between 10 and 15 percent, as well as temperatures ranging from 5 to nearly 20 degrees above normal and an unstable airmass, to produce widespread critical fire weather conditions. Critical fire weather conditions will return on Wednesday over much of western and central New Mexico where several hours of single digit relative humidity are forecast along with strong northwest winds. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM MDT THIS EVENING... ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM NOON TO 8 PM MDT WEDNESDAY... The National Weather Service in Albuquerque has issued a Red Flag Warning...which is in effect from noon to 8 PM MDT Wednesday. The Fire Weather Watch is no longer in effect. * AREA AND TIMING...Northwest Plateau and Highlands, West Central Highlands, Middle Rio Grande Valley and Sandia, Manzano and Gallinas Mountains below any snowpack through 8pm this evening. Critical conditions are expected to redevelop from between noon and 8 pm Wednesday. * 20 FOOT WINDS...West to northwest 25 to 35 mph with gusts to 55 or 60 mph today. The strongest gusts are expected in the Central Highlands and Sandia, Manzano and Gallinas Mountains today. On Wednesday, northwest 20 to 30 mph with gusts to 45 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...Ranging from around 10 to 15 percent today and about 5 to 9 percent Wednesday. Up to 8 to 12 consecutive hours of single digit humidities forecast Wednesday in the Middle Rio Grande Valley. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Red Flag Warning.

area.areaDesc: Middle Rio Grande Valley; Northwest Highlands; Northwest Plateau; Sandia Manzano And Gallinas Mountains; West Central Highlands
